pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Metal Blocks
Timer: Adds 3 Metal Blocks every 2 turns

Half Health: Adds 2 rows of Metal Blocks
                  every 2 turns
clearingStrategy:
[Any]/[Aerodactyl]

Aurorus, Chatot,
Ninetales, Swellow,
Aerodactyl

Blaziken, Heatran,
Entei, Moltres
srankingStrategy:
Okay. This one is hard. With
constantly spawning of Metal Blocks,
you cant really do much to them
outside of Disruption Delay. Ninetales
has Block Smash but only removes 1
block at a time. Buy DD if you can.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
Go with Move+5 and Disruption Delay
and a decent team

Bring Mega Aerodactyl here (Mega Start)
Aerodactyl will eat through the
blocks and will able to finish it in a few
turns

pokemon:
Board: 4th row is Metal Blocks, 1st and 2nd
           row are in Barriers, and field has
           only Axew, Fraxure, and Haxorus
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: All tile that fall afterwards are Metal
           Blocks
srankingStrategy:
Move C3 to B3. Then C3 to A3. 
Then F3 to C3. Then E3 to C3.
Then D3 to C3. The rest will fall into
place. 

An alternate strategy is:
A3-B3, C3-D3, B3-D3, D3-E3, E3-F3

pokemon:
Board: Random no. of Espeons
Initial: None

          Adds 2 Metal blocks after 2 turns
          Adds 3 Barriers,adds 7 Metal Blocks
          after 2 turns x2
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]

Zoroark, Heracross,
Sableye, Scizor

Absol, Yveltal

Giratina
srankingStrategy:
First things first: You may want to get
both Absol and Yveltal before going to
this stage. This is beatable with only
Disruption Delay if you are lucky with
combos. Otherwise, Complexity, DD, 
and Move+5 will do this without
having that much trouble.
notes:
Moves: At least 11 moves left
DD and Move+5 (you dont need Mega Start)
and with decent team of levels about 5+

For those who have issues with the items
used, a Complexity and DD will be enough
to do this
mobileNotes:
11th Megastone (assuming no
Competition Mega Stones)

You may want to get some
EX Pokemons after this
